titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Charles Cheney Foote Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:32

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers of Charles Cheney Foote consist of medical school lecture notes, an account book, and an index of medical conditions and medications.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Yale University Historical Medical Library, 1980.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles Cheney Foote Papers (MS 1304). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Charles Cheney Foote was born on September 6, 1825 in Jamestown, New York. He graduated from Union College in 1849 and then attended lectures at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of New York. He also attended lectures at Jefferson Medical College of Philadelphia, from which he graduated in 1851. Foote practiced medicine in New Haven, Connecticut with his father, Elial Foote. He died on November 9, 1871.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of Charles Cheney Foote consist of medical school lecture notes, an account book, and an index of medical conditions and medications.

did.unittitle: Medical school lecture notes; account book; index of medical conditions and medications
